## Library loading

```{r Packages, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
library(tidyverse) ; packageVersion("tidyverse")
library(viridis) ; packageVersion("viridis")
library(dplyr)
library(gtools)
library(patchwork)
library(data.table)
library(stringr)
```


```{r Set working directory, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
# You might need to set the working directory manually in the terminal, tut mir leid :(
setwd("/Users/bgracia/Dropbox (PopGen)/Bosco/PhD_Dropbox/DrosEU-microbiome/data")

list.files()
```


```{r Tables loading, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
# We load the metadata from the two projects

metadata_PRJNA308584 <- read.table("metadata_PRJNA308584.tsv", sep = "\t", header=T)
metadata_PRJNA308584 <- metadata_PRJNA308584[,c()]
ENA_PRJNA308584 <- read.table("ENA_PRJNA308584.tsv", sep = "\t", header=T)

metadata_PRJNA388788 <- read.table("metadata_PRJNA388788.tsv", sep = "\t", header=T)
metadata_PRJNA388788 <- metadata_PRJNA388788[,c(1:3,6:9,13)]
ENA_PRJNA388788 <- read.table("ENA_PRJNA388788.tsv", sep = "\t", header=T)

```


```{r Tables merging, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
# We merge the available data from each project




metadata_PRJNA308584 <- read.table("metadata_PRJNA308584.tsv", sep = "\t", header=T)
ENA_PRJNA308584 <- read.table("ENA_PRJNA308584.tsv", sep = "\t", header=T)

metadata_PRJNA388788 <- read.table("metadata_PRJNA388788.tsv", sep = "\t", header=T)
ENA_PRJNA388788 <- read.table("ENA_PRJNA388788.tsv", sep = "\t", header=T)

```
## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}
summary(cars)
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
